contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox film | name = Queen of Media | image = | image_size = | caption = | director = Furqaan Claver | producer = Richard Miller | writer = Kimba Henriques, <br> Furqaan Clover | narrator = | starring = [[Robin Givens]]<br>[[Fredro Starr]]<br>Jas Anderson<br>[[Michael Boatman]]<br>[[Leslie Drake]] | music = | cinematography = | editing = | distributor = | released = 2010 | runtime = | country = [[United States]] | language = [[English language|English]] | budget = | gross = | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Queen of Media''''' is a 2008 [[United States|American]] [[drama film]], directed by Furqaan Clover, starring [[Robin Givens]]. The film is loosely-based on ''[[The New York Times]]'' [[The New York Times Best Seller list|best seller]]{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} ''Wendy's Got the Heat'' by [[Wendy Williams (media personality)|Wendy Williams]]. It stars [[Robin Givens]] in the title role. It was written by [[Jim Yoakum]] with Furqaan Clover. It was produced by Guardian Entertainment. The release date is still unknown. ==Plot== The film is loosely-based on a real life story which tells the biography of [[New York City]] [[radio host]] [[Wendy Williams (radio host)|Wendy Williams]]. [[Robin Givens]] portrays Williams, and [[Oliver "Power" Grant]] as her husband Kevin Hunter. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|0883399|Queen of Media}} * {{http://www.blackfilm.com/20071108/features/queenofmedia.shtml}} * {{http://www.bvonmovies.com/2007/11/26/get-ready-for-queen-of-media-the-wendy-williams-story/}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Queen Of Media}} [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:2008 films]] [[Category:2000s drama films]] {{2000s-drama-film-stub}}
